channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI Close to Deal that Values Company at $300 Billion
item.description: The Japanese conglomerate SoftBank would invest up to $40 billion in the maker of the chatbot ChatGPT.

item.title: The company behind Shaq’s Super Bowl party says it solved the industry’s ‘dirty secret’ and will make $15 million from 3 events
item.description: Medium Rare hosts Shaq’s Fun House, Guy’s Flavortown Tailgate, and SI The Party, expecting tens of thousands of fans this weekend.

item.title: Congo Buries Its Dead After Rebel Assault
item.description: A single image captures the grim task facing those who needed to find space for the dead after a spasm of violence in Central Africa.

item.title: A workforce management giant will lay off 1,750 employees to make way for AI
item.description: Nearly 8.5% of staffers will be affected, joining the ranks of Salesforce and Klarna in paving a new way of work.

item.title: Grenfell Tower Was a Death Trap. Some Wanted It to Stand as a Warning.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil, Killing 2
item.description: Six people on the ground were also injured by the plane, part of which struck a bus on the road when it crashed.

item.title: Job Market Gives Fed Cover to Extend Interest Rate Pause
item.description: The central bank is grappling with how quickly to lower interest rates after pausing cuts last month.

item.title: Here’s what Chevron CEO Mike Wirth thinks about the hit TV show ‘Landman’
item.description: "And so, you know, there's certain aspects of it that are that are accurate and others that are probably just a touch exaggerated."

item.title: She helped get Black-owned brands on store shelves. Even as the tide turns against DEI, she’s determined to keep them there
item.description: Target's DEI pivot was received the worst by consumers of any company's.
